google_reviews.author: Katya
google_reviews.review: They cleaned out apartment so well before moving in. Everything was spotless and new carpet. The office workers are really nice. We can hardly ever hear neighbors or upstairs, there's a nice big grassy area to walk a dog and the price is really good for the quality and size. Main downside, in my opinion, is the dated interior, which included a bathroom with consistent mold issues, but it was manageable with regular cleaning of the ceiling.

google_reviews.author: Kate Ortiz
google_reviews.review: Affordable, close to town, bus route, and other services. Month to month so good for students. I moved here because it was one of the few affordable places i could have my cats and have easy bus access to school. I've been here for two and a half years and have been very content. Quiet and warm too - hardly ever any big parties because there's not many students. Office responds to concerns quickly. Spacious. I have no complaints. Some people complain that you have to pay for laundry but it's about half the price of the Bellingham Cleaning Center nearby and it saves a ton on the electric bill. Plus you can do three loads at once! anyway, really great place to live.

summary.text:
Good

The Hideaway Apartments present some commendable aspects according to user reviews. A consistent highlight is the property's cleanliness upon move-in, with apartments described as spotless and even featuring new carpeting, which new tenants appreciate. Additionally, the office staff at Hideaway Apartments are praised for their niceness and responsiveness to concerns, which contributes positively to the living experience. When it comes to amenities, the spaciousness of the apartments and the quiet, warm atmosphere are mentioned, with very few disturbances or big parties, making it suitable for tenants who prefer a tranquil environment.

Some tenants have also noted the affordability and convenience of Hideaway Apartments, emphasizing its proximity to town, public transportation, and other services. For those with pets, the apartments are one of the few affordable options where cats are welcome, further enhancing their appeal to pet owners. Additionally, the large grassy areas provide a nice space for dog walking, and overall, the setting proves to be a comfortable place for long-term living, as some tenants have stated they were very content even after a few years of residence.

Great

Aside from the generally good aspects, certain facets of living at Hideaway Apartments have stood out as particularly great. The community enjoys month-to-month leasing, which is notably favorable for students and individuals seeking flexible living arrangements. This flexibility is complemented by the quietness of the community, with minimal student presence, thereby reducing the likelihood of frequent parties and noise disruptions. Furthermore, the price quality ratio has been commended, with tenants feeling they receive good value considering the size and quality of the space relative to the cost.

The apartments' location also holds a significant benefit for students and commuters, with easy bus access facilitating travel to school or work. This convenience, along with the ability to manage laundry affordably on-site, albeit with a fee, provides residents with a practical living situation. As one tenant expressed, the ability to do multiple laundry loads simultaneously is a small but appreciated advantage when it comes to managing household chores efficiently.

Bad

However, not all experiences at Hideaway Apartments have been positive, with several user reviews pointing out issues that detract from the overall quality of living. One of the recurrent problems mentioned is the dated interiors of the apartments, with specific grievances about consistent mold issues, particularly in the bathrooms despite regular cleaning efforts. Maintenance concerns also extend to infestations, with reports of silverfish and black ants during summer, which is bothersome for many tenants.

Another common critique is related to the quality of communal facilities, such as the laundry rooms. Users have expressed dissatisfaction with the lack of regular sanitization of the washers and dryers. Furthermore, one resident's concern about a neighbor frequently discarding mattresses, some with visible bed bug stains, raises questions about the management's control over sanitation and cleanliness in shared spaces, creating unease among tenants about potential pest issues within the property.

Ugly

The uglier aspects of Hideaway Apartments reveal more serious concerns based on user reviews. There are alarming accounts of black mold being hidden within walls, only to become apparent weeks after moving in. Such allegations paint a grim picture of living conditions that could pose health risks to residents. In addition, there are reports of package misplacement and a significant presence of drug activity in the vicinity, further undermining the safety and security of the community.

More unsettling are the claims of finding drug paraphernalia, such as needles, around the property and incidents of theft from cars and laundry rooms. A non-functional security camera that only serves as a deterrent in appearance casts doubt on the effectiveness of security measures implemented by the property management. These dire shortcomings, combined with complaints about the entirety of security deposits being withheld without apparent justification, contribute to a worrisome living experience for some residents of Hideaway Apartments.
